newsitem.title: USA: Bay St. Louis, Hancock Cty, Miss., voters okay GOs.
newsitem.headline: Bay St. Louis, Hancock Cty, Miss., voters okay GOs.

text.p: Voters in Mississippi's Hancock County and Bay St. Louis-Waveland school districts approved two general obligation bond issues totaling $29 million, elections officials said.

Hancock County School District voters approved a $20 million issue with 65 percent of the votes in Tuesday's referendum. Proceeds will finance construction of two new schools and repairs at four schools.

Voters in the Bay St. Louis-Waveland district approved their $9 million bond issue with a 75 percent majaority. Proceeds will finance constuction of a new middle school and repairs and improvements at schools.
Both issues required at least 60 percent approval to pass.
